meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>pearl</kanji> <kanji>calculation</kanji> is calculations you do with pearls. If you think about using pearls to calculate something, it's going to look a lot like using an abacus. That's why this calculation is <vocabulary>calculation with abacus</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own. Watch out for the rendaku.
